comments: Williams (CHA) establishes himself in Barrett's (NYK) path with his arms slightly extended when marginal contact occurs during the screen.
Hart (NYK) maintains a legal guarding position and incidental contact occurs as he defends Hayward (CHA) at the end of the drive.
Williams (CHA) is imminently exiting the lane within three seconds.

Washington (CHA) maintains a legal guarding position alongside of Randle (NYK) and makes clean contact with the ball to dislodge it at the end of the drive. Williams (CHA) deflects the loose ball away from Randle after it has been dislodged.

Quickley (NYK) jumps along the same trajectory as Rozier (CHA), toward the basket, during his contest and any contact with Rozier's foot as he slightly extends it back when he releases the shot is deemed marginal. Both Barrett (NYK) and Quickley avoid any contact with Rozier's arm as they contest the shot attempt.
Washington (CHA) retreats his arm into a vertical position and absorbs the marginal contact that occurs with Hart (NYK) before cleanly blocking the driving shot attempt.
Hart (NYK) is the last player to touch the ball before it goes out of bounds. Possession is correctly awarded to the Hornets.
Quickley (NYK) legally contests Oubre Jr.'s (CHA) jump shot, making "high-five" contact after the ball is released.
Washington (CHA) loses his balance and does not maintain a legal guarding position as he initiates contact with Randle's (NYK) arm, which affects his driving shot attempt.
Hayward (CHA) delivers contact with both hands to Hart's (NYK) front, which dislodges him from his legally obtained position off-ball.
Randle (NYK) gives a step of distance when establishing himself in Rozier's (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs as they come together during the pick.

Washington (CHA) moves alongside Quickley's (NYK) path and absorbs the body contact during the driving shot attempt. Washington immediately removes his resting arm from Quickley's back and the contact is marginal.
Randle (NYK) extends his forearm and delivers contact that dislodges Rozier (CHA) during the rebound.
Washington (CHA) retreats alongside Barrett's (NYK) path with his arm in a vertical position and absorbs the marginal contact during the driving shot attempt.
Washington (CHA) briefly grasps Randle's (NYK) arm and marginal contact occurs as they engage during their pursuit for the rebound.

Washington (CHA) reaches for the rebound and marginal contact occurs as he grazes Barrett's (NYK) during his putback shot attempt at the basket.  Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Washington (CHA) is the last player to touch the loose ball before it goes out of bounds. Possession correctly remains with the Knicks.
Hayward (CHA) legally contests Grimes' (NYK) jump shot attempt.
Randle (NYK) makes contact with Oubre Jr.'s (CHA) arm, which affects his ability to maintain possession as he secures the rebound.
Randle (NYK) establishes himself in Oubre Jr.'s (CHA) path and marginal contact occurs as they come together during the screen.
Washington (CHA) legally contests Randle's (NYK) jump shot attempt.
